ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to conduct and write my own psychology research
I learned how to properly write out an APA research psychology paper. I learned how to conduct my own research, both correlational and experimentational.
Great class! Learned how to conduct research and write paper
I developed the ability to write a psychology academic paper. I also developed the ability to analyze statistical data and write about my results.
I learned about research in general and psychological experiments, including how to conduct one and write a research paper
I learned how to properly write a research paper and conduct a study.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everything was great, I wouldn't change a thing.

This class was one of the most organized classes I've taken at Yale. Assignment expectations, goals, and due dates were beyond clear, things were assigned in pieces so as to pace the students' writing progress, and the content was highly engaging as we were conducting our own studies in areas that interested us. The work load was also extremely manageable even though a lot was happening, as the flipped classroom model enabled us a great space to make progress on our projects while getting our questions answered.

Strengths = I liked the model of the class where we did work in class and went through readings outside of class. This was a very helpful way to get feedback and go through the process of research with support. Small class size. 
Weaknesses = maybe a bigger budget for the individual research could be better so that we can get a larger sample size.
Real well done. Manageable work load and always productive. Well taught

Strengths: excellent teacher and TA, interesting material, flexible in topics of psychological research, felt I learned a lot
Weakness: none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. My experience with Prof Kinney and TF Mandy was wonderful. The flipped classroom model was super helpful for completing our research projects (textbook content as homework, work time in class), and it was just really useful to actually conduct your own study under a lot of guidance to gain experience for future lab work.
Yes, the class was very easy to follow and there is a lot of support for each assignment. It is also helpful and interesting to do your own research with support.
Yes, Id recommend you take this as a psychology major in order to learn how to write academic papers.
Yes. The professor and TA were great. The course was well-organized for learning, there was lots of opportunity for feedback to improve writing and understanding of how to write a psychological paper
If it is a required course, yes I would recommend taking it, especially with Professor Kinney

All psychology students have to take this course, but I would especially recommend that they take it with professor Kinney if he teaches it again. I do recommend this class to students outside the major if they are interested in running experiments and collecting data. Although not an easy class per se, the class is a good way to fulfill your writing requirement without an absurd amount of writing.
